title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributions
text: Suggestions, requests, bug reports, code welcome. Please open issue fork repository submit pull request.

title: Contributions
text: Maintainers contributors must follow repository’s code conduct.

title: antanym
text: R package provides easy access Antarctic geographic place name information, tools working names. authoritative source place names Antarctica Composite Gazetteer Antarctica (CGA), produced Scientific Committee Antarctic Research (SCAR). CGA consists approximately 37,000 names corresponding 19,000 distinct features. covers features south 60 °S, including terrestrial undersea -ice features. single naming authority responsible place names Antarctica fall sovereignty one nation. general, individual countries administrative bodies responsible national policy , authorisation use , Antarctic names. CGA compilation place names submitted representatives national names committees 22 countries. composite nature CGA means may multiple names associated given feature. Consider using an_preferred() function resolving single name per feature. information, see CGA home page. CGA begun 1992. Since 2008, Italy Australia jointly managed CGA, former taking care editing, latter maintaining database website. SCAR Standing Committee Antarctic Geographic Information (SCAGI) coordinates project. R package product SCAR Expert Group Antarctic Biodiversity Informatics SCAGI.

title: antanym
text: SCAR Composite Gazetteer Antarctica made available CC-license. use , please cite : Composite Gazetteer Antarctica, Scientific Committee Antarctic Research. GCMD Metadata (http://gcmd.nasa.gov/records/SCAR_Gazetteer.html)

title: antanym
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/antanym")

title: antanym
text: Start fetching names data host server. use temporary cache can re-load later session without needing re-download : want able work offline, can cache data directory persist R sessions. location directory determined rappdirs::user_cache_dir() (see an_cache_directory("persistent") want know ): prefer working sp objects, return SpatialPointsDataFrame:
code: library(antanym) g <- an_read(cache = "session") g <- an_read(cache = "persistent") gsp <- an_read(sp = TRUE, cache = "session")

title: antanym
text: many names total? Corresponding many distinct features? can get list feature types data:
code: nrow(g) ## [1] 39141 length(unique(g$scar_common_id)) ## [1] 20123 head(an_feature_types(g), 10) ##  [1] "Aiguilles"           "Anchorage"           "Archipelago"         ##  [4] "Arm"                 "AWS"                 "Bank"                ##  [7] "Basin"               "Bay"                 "Beach"               ## [10] "Bedrock break point"

title: antanym
text: description data structure can found an_load function help, (information available via an_cga_metadata). default, gazetteer data consists columns: additional (probably less useful) columns can included calling an_read(..., simplified = FALSE). Consult an_read documentation information.

title: antanym
text: an_filter function provides range options find names interested .

title: antanym
text: simple search place name containing word ‘William’: can filter according country organisation issued name. bodies (countries organisations) provided names data? Find names containing “William” originating Australia USA: Compound names can slightly trickier. search return matches, actual place name ‘William Scoresby Archipelago’: get around , can split search terms matched separately (names matching “William” “Archipelago” returned): simple text query additionally constrained feature type: can use regular expression:
code: an_filter(g, query = "William") ## # A tibble: 75 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1      8          16073 William Scor… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ##  2     75          16074 William Scor… William Scoresby Bay        59.6    -67.4 ##  3    559          16090 Williamson G… Williamson Glacier         114.     -66.6 ##  4    643          16092 Williamson H… Williamson Head            158.     -69.2 ##  5   1240          16083 Williams Lake Williams Lake               78.2    -68.5 ##  6   1428          16096 Mount Willia… Mount Williams              50.8    -66.8 ##  7   1825          16084 Williams Nun… Williams Nunatak           111.     -66.4 ##  8   2189          16097 Point Willia… Point Williams              67.6    -67.8 ##  9   2430          16088 Williams Roc… Williams Rocks              62.8    -67.4 ## 10 100917           2288 Fort William… Fort William, punta        -59.6    -62.4 ## # ℹ 65 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_origins(g) ##  [1] "Argentina"                "Australia"                ##  [3] "Austria"                  "Belgium"                  ##  [5] "Bulgaria"                 "Canada"                   ##  [7] "Chile"                    "China"                    ##  [9] "Ecuador"                  "France"                   ## [11] "GEBCO"                    "Germany"                  ## [13] "India"                    "Italy"                    ## [15] "Japan"                    "Korea, Republic of"       ## [17] "New Zealand"              "Norway"                   ## [19] "Poland"                   "Russia"                   ## [21] "South Africa"             "Spain"                    ## [23] "Ukraine"                  "United Kingdom"           ## [25] "United States of America" "Uruguay" an_filter(g, query = "William", origin = "Australia|United States of America") ## # A tibble: 39 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1      8          16073 William Scor… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ##  2     75          16074 William Scor… William Scoresby Bay        59.6    -67.4 ##  3    559          16090 Williamson G… Williamson Glacier         114.     -66.6 ##  4    643          16092 Williamson H… Williamson Head            158.     -69.2 ##  5   1240          16083 Williams Lake Williams Lake               78.2    -68.5 ##  6   1428          16096 Mount Willia… Mount Williams              50.8    -66.8 ##  7   1825          16084 Williams Nun… Williams Nunatak           111.     -66.4 ##  8   2189          16097 Point Willia… Point Williams              67.6    -67.8 ##  9   2430          16088 Williams Roc… Williams Rocks              62.8    -67.4 ## 10 125297           4839 Fort William  Fort William               -59.7    -62.4 ## # ℹ 29 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_filter(g, query = "William Archipelago") ## # A tibble: 0 × 14 ## # ℹ 14 variables: gaz_id <dbl>, scar_common_id <dbl>, place_name <chr>, ## #   place_name_transliterated <chr>, longitude <dbl>, latitude <dbl>, ## #   altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, date_named <dttm>, ## #   narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, relic <lgl>, ## #   gazetteer <chr> an_filter(g, query = c("William", "Archipelago")) ## # A tibble: 2 × 14 ##   gaz_id scar_common_id place_name     place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##    <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>          <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ## 1      8          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## 2 133723          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_filter(g, query = "William", feature_type = "Archipelago") ## # A tibble: 2 × 14 ##   gaz_id scar_common_id place_name     place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##    <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>          <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ## 1      8          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## 2 133723          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## # A tibble: 2 × 14 ##   gaz_id scar_common_id place_name     place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##    <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>          <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ## 1      8          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## 2 133723          16073 William Score… William Scoresby Arch…      59.8    -67.3 ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## title: antanym
text: Regular expressions also allow complex searches. example, names matching “West” “East”: Names starting “West” “East”: Names “West” “East” appearing complete words name (“\b” matches word boundary; see help("regex")):
code: an_filter(g, query = "West|East") ## # A tibble: 142 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1     12          15899 West Arm      West Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  2     13           4025 East Arm      East Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  3    556          14345 Sylwester Gl… Sylwester Glacier          160.     -84.2 ##  4    738          15908 West Ice She… West Ice Shelf              85      -67   ##  5    870           4028 East Budd Is… East Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  6    895          15904 West Budd Is… West Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  7    976           4041 Easther Isla… Easther Island              76.2    -69.4 ##  8   1169           4032 East Lake     East Lake                  143.     -67.0 ##  9   1337           4030 East Egerton  East Egerton               158.     -80.8 ## 10   1848          15923 Westhaven Nu… Westhaven Nunatak          154.     -79.8 ## # ℹ 132 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_filter(g, query = "^(West|East)") ## # A tibble: 96 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1     12          15899 West Arm      West Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  2     13           4025 East Arm      East Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  3    738          15908 West Ice She… West Ice Shelf              85      -67   ##  4    870           4028 East Budd Is… East Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  5    895          15904 West Budd Is… West Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  6    976           4041 Easther Isla… Easther Island              76.2    -69.4 ##  7   1169           4032 East Lake     East Lake                  143.     -67.0 ##  8   1337           4030 East Egerton  East Egerton               158.     -80.8 ##  9   1848          15923 Westhaven Nu… Westhaven Nunatak          154.     -79.8 ## 10   2195          15927 Westwood Poi… Westwood Point              77.9    -68.6 ## # ℹ 86 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_filter(g, query = "\\b(West|East)\\b") ## # A tibble: 97 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1     12          15899 West Arm      West Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  2     13           4025 East Arm      East Arm                    62.9    -67.6 ##  3    738          15908 West Ice She… West Ice Shelf              85      -67   ##  4    870           4028 East Budd Is… East Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  5    895          15904 West Budd Is… West Budd Island            62.8    -67.6 ##  6   1169           4032 East Lake     East Lake                  143.     -67.0 ##  7   1337           4030 East Egerton  East Egerton               158.     -80.8 ##  8   2489          15915 West Stack    West Stack                  58.1    -67.0 ##  9   2490           4038 East Stack    East Stack                  58.3    -67.1 ## 10 105006           1690 Bowles West … Bowles West Peak           -60.2    -62.6 ## # ℹ 87 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## title: antanym
text: can filter spatial extent: extent can also passed Spatial Raster object, case extent used: Searching proximity given point, example islands within 20km 100 °E, 66 °S:
code: an_filter(g, extent = c(100, 120, -70, -65)) ## # A tibble: 752 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1      7           6373 Highjump Arc… Highjump Archipelago        101.    -66.0 ##  2     15           8581 Loewe Massif… Loewe Massif Automati…      112.    -68.4 ##  3     17           8210 Law Dome Sum… Law Dome Summit             113.    -66.7 ##  4     28          11156 Petersen Bank Petersen Bank               111.    -65.8 ##  5     31           8143 Larsen Bank   Larsen Bank                 111.    -66.3 ##  6     41           8700 Luchistaja B… Luchistaja Bay              101.    -66.1 ##  7     42           8881 Majachnaja B… Majachnaja Bay              101.    -66.2 ##  8     44           8339 Leonova Bay   Leonova Bay                 101.    -66.2 ##  9     45          15468 Vetvistaja B… Vetvistaja Bay              101.    -66.1 ## 10     46          10722 Ostrovnaja B… Ostrovnaja Bay              101.    -66.2 ## # ℹ 742 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> my_sp <- sp::SpatialPoints(cbind(c(100, 120), c(-70, -65))) an_filter(g, extent = my_sp) ## # A tibble: 752 × 14 ##    gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_translite…¹ longitude latitude ##     <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                      <dbl>    <dbl> ##  1      7           6373 Highjump Arc… Highjump Archipelago        101.    -66.0 ##  2     15           8581 Loewe Massif… Loewe Massif Automati…      112.    -68.4 ##  3     17           8210 Law Dome Sum… Law Dome Summit             113.    -66.7 ##  4     28          11156 Petersen Bank Petersen Bank               111.    -65.8 ##  5     31           8143 Larsen Bank   Larsen Bank                 111.    -66.3 ##  6     41           8700 Luchistaja B… Luchistaja Bay              101.    -66.1 ##  7     42           8881 Majachnaja B… Majachnaja Bay              101.    -66.2 ##  8     44           8339 Leonova Bay   Leonova Bay                 101.    -66.2 ##  9     45          15468 Vetvistaja B… Vetvistaja Bay              101.    -66.1 ## 10     46          10722 Ostrovnaja B… Ostrovnaja Bay              101.    -66.2 ## # ℹ 742 more rows ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr> an_near(an_filter(g, feature_type = "Island"), loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 20) ## # A tibble: 3 × 14 ##   gaz_id scar_common_id place_name    place_name_transliter…¹ longitude latitude ##    <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>         <chr>                       <dbl>    <dbl> ## 1   1027           4856 Foster Island Foster Island                100.    -66.1 ## 2 120508           4856 Severnyj holm Severnyj holm                100.    -66.1 ## 3 125310           4856 Foster Island Foster Island                100.    -66.1 ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​place_name_transliterated ## # ℹ 8 more variables: altitude <dbl>, feature_type_name <chr>, ## #   date_named <dttm>, narrative <chr>, named_for <chr>, origin <chr>, ## #   relic <lgl>, gazetteer <chr>

title: antanym
text: noted , CGA composite gazetteer may multiple names associated given feature. Find names associated feature 1589 (Booth Island) show country origin name: an_preferred function can help finding one name per feature. takes origin parameter specifies one preferred naming authorities (countries organisations). features multiple names (e.g. named multiple countries) single name chosen, preferring names specified  naming authorities possible. start 39141 names full CGA, corresponding 20123 distinct features. Choose one name per feature, preferring Polish name one, German name second preference: Now 20123 names data frame, corresponding 20123 distinct features. Features named either preferred countries name chosen another country, countries random order preference.
code: an_filter(g, feature_ids = 1589)[, c("place_name", "origin")] ## # A tibble: 7 × 2 ##   place_name   origin                   ##   <chr>        <chr>                    ## 1 Booth, isla  Argentina                ## 2 Wandel, Ile  Belgium                  ## 3 Booth, Isla  Chile                    ## 4 Boothinsel   Germany                  ## 5 Booth Island United Kingdom           ## 6 Booth Island Russia                   ## 7 Booth Island United States of America g <- an_preferred(g, origin = c("Poland", "Germany"))

title: antanym
text: functionality can achieved piped workflow, ’s preference, e.g.:
code: nms <- g %>% an_filter(feature_type = "Island") %>% an_near(loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 20) nms[, c("place_name", "longitude", "latitude")] ## # A tibble: 1 × 3 ##   place_name    longitude latitude ##   <chr>             <dbl>    <dbl> ## 1 Severnyj holm      100.    -66.1

title: antanym
text: prefer work Spatial objects, gazetteer data can converted SpatialPointsDataFrame loaded: functions work way, example:
code: gsp <- an_read(cache = "session", sp = TRUE) my_sp <- sp::SpatialPoints(cbind(c(100, 120), c(-70, -65))) an_filter(gsp, extent = my_sp) ## class       : SpatialPointsDataFrame  ## features    : 752  ## extent      : 100, 120, -69, -65  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs         : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## variables   : 12 ## names       : gaz_id, scar_common_id,       place_name, place_name_transliterated, altitude, feature_type_name, date_named,                                                                                                                                                                        narrative,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   named_for,                   origin, relic, gazetteer  ## min values  :      7,             54,    Adams Glacier,             Adams Glacier,        0,       Archipelago, -725846400,                                                                                                                                      "Bunger Hills.  Charted by the SAE in 1956.,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               A distinct feature that provides access through the ASPA without trampling vegetation.  Moss biologists describe Casey as the Daintree of Antarctica to educate people about the importance of the vegetation,                Australia,     0,       CGA  ## max values  : 140427,          20125, Zimmerman Island,          Zimmerman Island,     1395,       Watercourse, 1575849600, Valley near Polish Antarctic A. B. Dobrowolski Station, with a small lake, Burger Hills area. Named in honour of Professor Stefan Manczarski (1899-1979) - see Manczarski Point., Winning name recommended by Dr Andie Smithies, Convenor, Advisory Committee on Names Competition in September 2004.This was a public competition for the naming of a new runway in August 2004. The reason given by Joe Weiley (12 years), of Broken Head NSW, student at St Finbars School in Byron Bay and the winner of the competition was:  "It would have to be named after Sir Hubert Wilkins, the amazing Australian adventurer and pioneer of Antarctic aviation!", United States of America,     0,       CGA

title: antanym
text: Let’s say preparing figure greater Prydz Bay region (60-90 °E, 65-70 °S), shown 80mm x 80mm size (approximately 1:10M scale map). Let’s plot place names region:  Oooooo-kay. ’s ideal. Antanym includes experimental function suggest features might best add names given map. suggestions based maps prepared expert cartographers, features explicitly named maps. can ask suggested names show example map: Plot top ten suggested names purely score:  ten best suggested names considering score spatial coverage:
code: my_longitude <- c(60, 90) my_latitude <- c(-70, -65)  this_names <- an_filter(g, extent = c(my_longitude, my_latitude))  if (!requireNamespace("rworldmap", quietly = TRUE)) {   message("Skipping map figure - install the rworldmap package to see it.") } else {   library(rworldmap)   map <- getMap(resolution = "low")   plot(map, xlim = my_longitude + c(-7, 4), ylim = my_latitude, col = "grey50")   ## allow extra xlim space for labels   points(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, pch = 21, bg = "green", cex = 2)   ## alternate the positions of labels to reduce overlap   pos <- rep(c(1, 2, 3, 4), ceiling(nrow(this_names)/4))   pos[order(this_names$longitude)] <- pos[1:nrow(this_names)]   text(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, labels = this_names$place_name, pos = pos) } suggested <- an_suggest(g, map_extent = c(my_longitude, my_latitude), map_dimensions = c(80, 80)) this_names <- head(suggested, 10)  if (!requireNamespace("rworldmap", quietly = TRUE)) {   message("Skipping map figure - install the rworldmap package to see it.") } else {   plot(map, xlim = my_longitude + c(-7, 4), ylim = my_latitude, col = "grey50")   points(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, pch = 21, bg = "green", cex = 2)   pos <- rep(c(1, 2, 3, 4), ceiling(nrow(this_names)/4))   pos[order(this_names$longitude)] <- pos[1:nrow(this_names)]   text(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, labels = this_names$place_name, pos = pos) } this_names <- an_thin(suggested, n = 10)  if (!requireNamespace("rworldmap", quietly = TRUE)) {   message("Skipping map figure - install the rworldmap package to see it.") } else {   plot(map, xlim = my_longitude + c(-7, 4), ylim = my_latitude, col = "grey50")   points(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, pch = 21, bg = "green", cex = 2)   pos <- rep(c(1, 2, 3, 4), ceiling(nrow(this_names)/4))   pos[order(this_names$longitude)] <- pos[1:nrow(this_names)]   text(this_names$longitude, this_names$latitude, labels = this_names$place_name, pos = pos) }

title: antanym
text: leaflet app using Mercator projection clustered markers place names.  similar example using polar stereographic projection.  See antanym-demo repository source code examples.

title: antanym
text: Antanym currently provides information SCAR CGA. cover features may interest Antarctic researchers, subantarctic islands features informal names registered CGA. Antanym may expanded cover extra gazetteers containing information, later date.

title: antanym
text: geonames package also provides access geographic place names, including SCAR Composite Gazetteer. need global place name coverage, geonames may better option. However, composite nature CGA particularly well suited geonames, time writing geonames database include current version CGA. geonames package requires login functionality, makes calls api.geonames.org isn’t easily used offline.

text: Secretariat SCAR (1992 updated 2024) Composite Gazetteer Antarctica, Scientific Committee Antarctic Research. GCMD Metadata (http://gcmd.nasa.gov/records/SCAR_Gazetteer.html) Data obtained via antanym R package:  https://github.com/ropensci/antanym
code: @Manual{,   title = {Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica, Scientific Committee on Antarctic Research. Data obtained via the antanym R package: https://github.com/ropensci/antanym},   author = {{Secretariat SCAR}},   year = {1992, updated 2024},   url = {http://gcmd.nasa.gov/records/SCAR_Gazetteer.html}, }

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: R package provides easy access Antarctic geographic place name information, tools working names. authoritative source place names Antarctica Composite Gazetteer Antarctica (CGA), produced Scientific Committee Antarctic Research (SCAR). CGA consists approximately 37,000 names corresponding 19,000 distinct features. covers features south 60 °S, including terrestrial undersea -ice. single naming authority responsible place names Antarctica fall sovereignty one nation. general, individual countries administrative bodies responsible national policy , authorisation use , Antarctic names. CGA compilation place names submitted representatives national names committees 22 countries. composite nature CGA means often multiple names associated given feature. Consider using an_preferred() function resolving single name per feature. information, see CGA home page. CGA begun 1992. Since 2008, Italy Australia jointly managed CGA, former taking care editing, latter maintaining database website. SCAR Standing Committee Antarctic Geographic Information (SCAGI) coordinates project. R package product SCAR Expert Group Antarctic Biodiversity Informatics SCAGI.

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: SCAR Composite Gazetteer Antarctica made available CC-license. use , please cite : Composite Gazetteer Antarctica, Scientific Committee Antarctic Research. GCMD Metadata (http://gcmd.nasa.gov/records/SCAR_Gazetteer.html)

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/antanym")

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: Start fetching names data host server. use temporary cache can re-load later session without needing re-download : many names total? Corresponding many distinct features? Find names starting “Slom”: Find islands within 20km 100 °E, 66 °S:
code: library(antanym) g <- an_read(cache = "session") nrow(g) #> [1] 37661 length(unique(g$scar_common_id)) #> [1] 19601 an_filter(g, query = "^Slom")[, c("place_name", "longitude", "latitude")] #> # A tibble: 3 x 3 #>   place_name     longitude latitude #>   <chr>              <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Sloman Glacier     -68.6    -67.7 #> 2 Sloman Glacier     -68.6    -67.7 #> 3 Slomer Cove        -59.4    -63.8 nms <- an_near(an_filter(g, feature_type = "Island"), loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 20)  ## or equivalently, using the pipe operator nms <- g %>% an_filter(feature_type = "Island") %>% an_near(loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 20)  nms[, c("place_name", "longitude", "latitude")] #> # A tibble: 3 x 3 #>   place_name    longitude latitude #>   <chr>             <dbl>    <dbl> #> 1 Foster Island       100    -66.1 #> 2 Severnyj holm       100    -66.1 #> 3 Foster Island       100    -66.1

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: noted , CGA composite gazetteer often multiple names associated given feature. example, can see names associated feature 1589 (Booth Island) country origin name: an_preferred function can help finding one name per feature. takes origin parameter specifies one preferred naming authorities (countries organisations). features multiple names (e.g. named multiple countries) single name chosen, preferring names specified naming authorities possible. start 37661 names full CGA, corresponding 19601 distinct features. Choose one name per feature, preferring Polish name one, German name second preference: Now 19601 names data frame, corresponding 19601 distinct features.
code: an_filter(g, feature_ids = 1589)[, c("place_name", "origin")] #> # A tibble: 7 x 2 #>   place_name   origin                   #>   <chr>        <chr>                    #> 1 Booth, isla  Argentina                #> 2 Wandel, Ile  Belgium                  #> 3 Booth, Isla  Chile                    #> 4 Boothinsel   Germany                  #> 5 Booth Island United Kingdom           #> 6 Booth Island Russia                   #> 7 Booth Island United States of America g <- an_preferred(g, origin = c("Poland", "Germany"))

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: Antanym includes experimental function suggest features might best name given map. suggestions based maps prepared expert cartographers, features explicitly named maps. See package vignette an_suggest function information.

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: General revisions following rOpenSci review. Note several breaking changes: an_read now takes cache parameter instead cache_directory (now can special values “session” “persistent”) an_filter an_suggest now take origin parameter replaces previous origin_country cga_source parameters default data structure (returned an_read(..., simplified = TRUE) longer contains “country_name” “cga_source_gazetteer columns, needed available via an_read(..., simplified = FALSE)

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: leaflet app using Mercator projection clustered markers place names.  similar example using polar stereographic projection.  See antanym-demo repository source code examples.

title: Antarctic Geographic Place Names
text: geonames package also provides access geographic place names, including SCAR Composite Gazetteer. need global place name coverage, geonames may better option. However, composite nature CGA particularly well suited geonames, time writing geonames database include current version CGA. geonames package requires login functionality, makes calls api.geonames.org isn’t easily used offline.

what: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
title: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
text: cache directory used antanym

title: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
code: an_cache_directory(cache)

title: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
text: cache string: gazetteer data can cached locally, can used offline later. Valid values "session", "persistent", directory name. Specifying cache="session" use temporary directory persists current session. cache="persistent" use rappdirs::user_cache_dir() determine appropriate directory use. Otherwise, input string assumed path directory use

title: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
text: directory path

title: The cache directory used by antanym — an_cache_directory
code: ## per-session caching an_cache_directory(cache = "session") #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpfYSDjy/antanym-cache"  ## persistent caching that will keep the data from one R session to the next an_cache_directory(cache = "persistent") #> [1] "~/.cache/antanym"

what: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
text: Composite Gazetteer Antarctica data structure (returned an_read):

title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
code: an_cga_metadata(simplified = TRUE)

title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
text: simplified logical: TRUE, describe simplified set columns (see equivalent parameter an_read)

title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
text: data frame columns "field" "description"

title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
text: https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/gaz/scar/, https://www.scar.org/data-products/place-names/

title: Information about the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica data structure — an_cga_metadata
code: an_cga_metadata() #>                        field #> 1                     gaz_id #> 2             scar_common_id #> 3                 place_name #> 4  place_name_transliterated #> 5                  longitude #> 6                   latitude #> 7                   altitude #> 8          feature_type_name #> 9                 date_named #> 10                 narrative #> 11                 named_for #> 12                    origin #> 13                     relic #> 14                 gazetteer #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   description #> 1  The unique identifier of each gazetteer entry. Note that the same feature (e.g. 'Browns Glacier') might have multiple gazetteer entries, each with their own gaz_id, because the feature has been named multiple times by different naming authorities. The scar_common_id value for these entries will be identical, because scar_common_id identifies the feature itself #> 2                                                                                                                                                                                                            The unique identifier (in the Composite Gazetteer of Antarctica) of the feature. A single feature may have multiple names, given by different naming authorities #> 3                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The name of the feature #> 4                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The name of the feature transliterated to simple ASCII characters (e.g. with diacritical marks removed) #> 5                                                                                                                 The longitude of the feature (negative values indicate degrees west). Note that many features are not point features (e.g. mountains, lakes), in which case the longitude and latitude values are indicative only, generally of the centroid of the feature #> 6                                                                                                                 The latitude of the feature (negative values indicate degrees south). Note that many features are not point features (e.g. mountains, lakes), in which case the longitude and latitude values are indicative only, generally of the centroid of the feature #> 7                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             The altitude of the feature, in metres relative to sea level. Negative values indicate features below sea level #> 8                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          The feature type (e.g. 'Archipelago', 'Channel', 'Mountain'). See an_feature_types for a full list #> 9                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The date on which the feature was named #> 10                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       A text description of the feature; may include a synopsis of the history of its name #> 11                                                                                                                                                                                              The person after whom the feature was named, or other reason for its naming. For historical reasons the distinction between 'narrative' and 'named for' is not always obvious #> 12                                                                                                                                                                                                                               The naming authority that provided the name. This is a country name, or organisation name for names that did not come from a national source #> 13                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     If TRUE, this name is associated with a feature that no longer exists (e.g. an ice shelf feature that has disappeared) #> 14                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The gazetteer from which this information came (currently only 'CGA')

what: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types
title: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types

title: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types
code: an_feature_types(gaz)

title: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: returned an_read, an_preferred, an_filter

title: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types
text: character vector country names

title: List feature types present in gazetteer data — an_feature_types
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## what feature types do we have in our data?  an_feature_types(g) }

what: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
text: data frame place names can filtered according name, geographic location, feature type, criteria. text-related matches default treated regular expressions case-insensitive: can change behaviour via ignore_case as_regex parameters.

title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
code: an_filter(   gaz,   query,   feature_ids,   extent,   feature_type,   origin,   origin_gazetteer,   ignore_case = TRUE,   as_regex = TRUE )

title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: returned an_read an_preferred query character: vector place name terms search . Returned place names match entries query feature_ids numeric: return place names associated features identified identifiers. Currently values can scar_common_id values extent vector c(longitude_min, longitude_max, latitude_min, latitude_max): provided, search names within bounding box. extent can also passed raster Extent object, Raster object (case extent used), Spatial object (case bounding box object used extent), matrix (case assumed output sp::bbox) feature_type string: return place names corresponding feature types matching pattern. valid feature type names see an_feature_types origin string: return place names originating bodies (countries organisations) matching pattern. valid origin values see link{an_origins} origin_gazetteer string: return place names originating gazetteers matching pattern. valid gazetteer names see an_gazetteers ignore_case logical: TRUE, use case-insensitive text matching as_regex logical: TRUE, treat query string input parameters regular expressions. FALSE, treated fixed strings match

title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
text: data.frame results

title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
text: https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/gaz/scar/, https://www.scar.org/data-products/place-names/

title: Filter a collection of place names by various criteria — an_filter
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## simple search for any place name containing the word 'William'  an_filter(g, query = "William")   ## which bodies (countries or organisations) provided the names in our data?  an_origins(g)   ## find names containing "William" and originating from Australia or the USA  an_filter(g, query = "William", origin = "Australia|United States of America")   ## this search will return no matches  ## because the actual place name is 'William Scoresby Archipelago'  an_filter(g, query = "William Archipelago")   ## we can split the search terms so that each is matched separately  an_filter(g, query = c("William", "Archipelago"))   ## or use a regular expression  an_filter(g, query = "William .* Archipelago")   ## or refine the search using feature type  an_filter(g, query = "William", feature_type = "Archipelago")   ## what feature types do we have in our data?  an_feature_types(g)   ## for more complex text searching, use regular expressions  ## e.g. names matching "West" or "East"  an_filter(g, query = "West|East")   ## names starting with "West" or "East"  an_filter(g, query = "^(West|East)")   ## names with "West" or "East" appearing as complete words in the name  ## ["\b" matches a word boundary: see help("regex") ]  an_filter(g, query = "\\b(West|East)\\b")   ## filtering by spatial extent  nms <- an_filter(g, extent = c(100, 120, -70, -65), origin = "Australia")  with(nms, plot(longitude, latitude))  with(nms, text(longitude, latitude, place_name))   ## searching within the extent of an sp object  my_sp <- sp::SpatialPoints(cbind(c(100, 120), c(-70, -65)))  an_filter(g, extent = my_sp)   ## or equivalently  an_filter(g, extent = bbox(my_sp))   ## or using the sp form of the gazetteer data  gsp <- an_read(cache = "session", sp = TRUE)  an_filter(gsp, extent = my_sp)   ## using the pipe operator  g %>% an_filter(query = "Ross", feature_type = "Ice shelf|Mountain")   g %>% an_near(loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 20) %>%        an_filter(feature_type = "Island")   ## find all names for feature 1589 and the naming  ##  authority for each name  an_filter(g, feature_ids = 1589)[, c("place_name", "origin")] }

what: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
text: Find placenames near given location

title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
code: an_near(gaz, loc, max_distance)

title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: returned an_read, an_preferred, an_filter loc numeric: target location (two-element numeric vector giving longitude latitude, SpatialPoints object) max_distance numeric: maximum search distance kilometres

title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
text: data.frame results

title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
text: https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/gaz/scar/, https://www.scar.org/data-products/place-names/

title: Find placenames near a given location — an_near
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## named features within 10km of 110E, 66S  an_near(g, loc = c(110, -66), max_distance = 10)   ## using pipe operator  g %>% an_near(loc = c(100, -66), max_distance = 10)   ## with sp objects  gsp <- an_read(cache = "session", sp = TRUE)  loc <- sp::SpatialPoints(matrix(c(110, -66), nrow = 1),    proj4string = CRS("+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +ellps=WGS84"))  an_near(gsp, loc = loc, max_distance = 10) }

what: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
text: Composite Gazetteer Antarctica compilation place names provided different countries organisations. composite nature CGA means may multiple names associated single feature. an_preferred function can used resolve single name per feature. Provide one origin entries input gaz filtered single name per feature. features multiple names (e.g. named multiple countries) single name chosen, preferring names specified origin bodies possible.

title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
code: an_preferred(gaz, origin, unmatched = "random")

title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: returned an_read an_filter origin character: vector preferred name origins (countries organisations), order preference. given feature named one bodies, place name chosen. feature question given name bodies, place name given another body chosen, preference according unmatched parameter. valid origin values, see an_origins unmatched string: names chosen features named one preferred origin bodies? Valid values "random" (non-preferred originating bodies randomly ordered) "count" (non-preferred originating bodies ordered number entries, largest first)

title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
text: data.frame results

title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
text: https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/gaz/scar/, https://www.scar.org/data-products/place-names/

title: Find one name per feature in the Composite Gazetteer — an_preferred
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## get a single name per feature, preferring the  ##  Polish name where there is one  pnames <- an_preferred(g, origin = "Poland")   ## names starting with "Sm", preferring US names then  ##  Australian ones if available  g %>% an_filter("^Sm") %>%        an_preferred(origin = c("United States of America", "Australia")) }

what: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
text: Place name data downloaded optionally cached locally. wish able use antanym offline, consider using cache = "persistent" cached data persist one R session next. See an_cache_directory get path cache directory.

title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
code: an_read(   gazetteers = "all",   sp = FALSE,   cache,   refresh_cache = FALSE,   simplified = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
text: gazetteers character: vector gazetteers load. list available gazetteers, see an_gazetteers. Use gazetteers = "" load available gazetteers. Currently one gazetteer available: Composite Gazetteer Antarctica sp logical: FALSE return data.frame; TRUE return SpatialPointsDataFrame cache string: gazetteer data can cached locally, can used offline later. Valid values "session", "persistent", directory name. Specifying cache = "session" use temporary directory persists current session. cache = "persistent" use rappdirs::user_cache_dir() determine appropriate directory use. Otherwise, string provided assumed path directory use. case, attempt made create cache directory exist. warning given cached copy data exists 30 days old refresh_cache logical: TRUE, data file already exists cache, refreshed. FALSE, cached copy used simplified logical: TRUE, return simplified set columns (see details "Value", ) verbose logical: show progress messages?

title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
text: data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame, following columns (note information populated place names): gaz_id - unique identifier gazetteer entry. Note feature (e.g. "Browns Glacier") might multiple gazetteer entries, gaz_id, feature named multiple times different naming authorities. scar_common_id entries identical, scar_common_id identifies feature scar_common_id - unique identifier (Composite Gazetteer Antarctica) feature. single feature may multiple names, given different naming authorities place_name - name feature place_name_transliterated - name feature transliterated simple ASCII characters (e.g. diacritical marks removed) longitude latitude - longitude latitude feature (negative values indicate degrees west south). Note many features point features (e.g. mountains, lakes), case longitude latitude values indicative , generally centroid feature altitude - altitude feature, metres relative sea level. Negative values indicate features sea level feature_type_name - feature type (e.g. "Archipelago", "Channel", "Mountain") date_named - date feature named narrative - text description feature; may include synopsis history name named_for - person feature named, reason naming. historical reasons distinction "narrative" "named " always obvious origin - naming authority provided name. country name, organisation name names come national source relic - TRUE, name associated feature longer exists (e.g. ice shelf feature disappeared) gazetteer - gazetteer information came (currently "CGA") simplified FALSE, additional columns also included: meeting_date - date name formally approved associated naming authority. available many names: see date_named column meeting_paper - references papers documents associated naming feature remote_sensor_info - text describing remote sensing information (e.g. satellite platform name image details) used define feature, applicable coordinate_accuracy - indicator accuracy coordinates, metres altitude_accuracy - indicator accuracy altitude value, metres cga_source_gazetteer - Composite Gazetteer, entry gives source gazetteer entry taken. currently either three-letter country code (e.g. "ESP", "USA") "GEBCO" (GEBCO gazetteer undersea features) country_name - full name country cga_source_gazetteer country source_name - cartographic/GIS/remote sensing source coordinates derived source_publisher - coordinates derived map, publisher map source_scale - scale map coordinates derived source_institution - institution coordinate information came source_person - contact person source institution, applicable source_country_code - country coordinate information came source_identifier - coordinate elevation derived map, identifier map comments - comments name naming process

title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
text: https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/gaz/scar/, https://www.scar.org/data-products/place-names/

title: Load Antarctic place name data — an_read
code: if (FALSE) {  ## download without caching  g <- an_read()   ## download to session cache, in sp format  g <- an_read(cache = "session", sp = TRUE)   ## download and cache to a persistent directory for later, offline use  g <- an_read(cache = "persistent")   ## refresh the cached copy  g <- an_read(cache = "persistent", refresh_cache = TRUE)   ## download and cache to a persistent directory of our choice  g <- an_read(cache = "c:/my/cache/directory") }

what: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
title: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
text: Features given suitability score based maps prepared expert cartographers. Data tabulated collection maps, indicating feature whether named given map, along details (scale) map. data used basis recommendation algorithm, suggests best features name map given properties (extent scale). experimental function currently implemented map_scale values 10 million larger.

title: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
code: an_suggest(gaz, map_scale, map_extent, map_dimensions)

title: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: returned an_read, an_preferred, an_filter map_scale numeric: scale map (e.g. 20e6 1:20M map). map_scale provided, estimated map_extent map_dimensions map_extent vector c(longitude_min, longitude_max, latitude_min, latitude_max): extent area name suggestions sought. required map_scale provided, optional map_scale provided (map_extent provided situation gaz data frame filtered extent suggestion algorithm applied; otherwise names gaz considered). map_extent can also passed raster Extent object, Raster object (case extent used), Spatial object (case bounding box object used extent), matrix (case assumed output sp::bbox) map_dimensions numeric: 2-element numeric giving width height map, mm. required map_scale provided

title: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
text: data.frame names "score" column added. Score values range 0 1. data frame sorted descending score order. Names higher scores suggested suitable display.

title: Suggest names for a map (experimental) — an_suggest
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## get a single name per feature, preferring the  ##  Australian name where there is one  g <- an_preferred(g, origin = "Australia")   ## suggested names for a 100x100 mm map covering 60-90E, 70-60S  ##  (this is about a 1:12M scale map)  suggested <- an_suggest(g, map_extent = c(60, 90, -70, -60), map_dimensions = c(100, 100))  head(suggested, 20) ## top 20 names   ## an equivalent result can be achieved by supplying map scale and extent  suggested <- an_suggest(g, map_scale = 12e6, map_extent = c(60, 90, -70, -60)) }

what: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
text: provided data.frame names thinned smaller number names. thinning process attempts select subset names uniformly spatially distributed, simultaneously choosing important names (according relative score score_col column.

title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
code: an_thin(gaz, n, score_col = "score", score_weighting = 5, row_limit = 2000)

title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
text: gaz data.frame SpatialPointsDataFrame: typically returned an_suggest n numeric: number names return score_col string: name column gives relative score name (e.g. returned an_suggest). Names higher scores preferred thinning process. specified score_col column present gaz, values within column equal, thinning based entirely spatial distribution features score_weighting numeric: weighting scores relative spatial distribution. lower score_weighting value tend choose lower-scored names order achieve better spatial uniformity. higher score_weighting value trade spatial uniformity favour selecting higher-scored names row_limit integer: maximum number rows allowed gaz; see Details. Data frames larger processed (error).

title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
text: data.frame

title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
text: Note algorithm calculates pairwise distances rows gaz. memory-intensive, gaz many rows algorithm fail platforms might crash. Input gaz data.frames row_limit rows processed reason. can try increasing row_limit default value necessary.

title: Thin names to give approximately uniform spatial coverage — an_thin
code: if (FALSE) {  g <- an_read(cache = "session")   ## get a single name per feature, preferring the  ##  Japanese name where there is one  g <- an_preferred(g, origin = "Japan")   ## suggested names for a 100x100 mm map covering 60-90E, 70-60S  ##  (this is about a 1:12M scale map)  suggested <- an_suggest(g, map_extent = c(60, 90, -70, -60), map_dimensions = c(100, 100))   ## find the top 20 names by score  head(suggested, 20)   ## find the top 20 names chosen for spatial coverage and score  an_thin(suggested, 20) }

title: antanym — antanym
text: Antarctic geographic place names Composite Gazetteer Antarctica, functions working place names.

title: antanym — antanym

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports

title: antanym 0.4.0
text: General revisions following rOpenSci review. Note several breaking changes: an_read now takes cache parameter instead cache_directory (now can special values “session” “persistent”) an_filter an_suggest now take origin parameter replaces previous origin_country cga_source parameters default data structure (returned an_read(..., simplified = TRUE) longer contains “country_name” “cga_source_gazetteer columns, needed available via an_read(..., simplified = FALSE)

text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
